metadata.title: CVE-2024-26585 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - high
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: tls:fix race between tx work scheduling and socket close Similarly to previouscommit, the submitting thread (recvmsg/sendmsg) may exit as soon as theasync crypto handler calls complete(). Reorder scheduling the work beforecalling complete(). This seems more logical in the first place, as it's theinverse order of what the submitting thread will do.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-26585` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:
